intro: Lepidium oxytrichum, commonly known as the slender cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–60 centimeters and features small, white or pink flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. The seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional herbal remedies.
